body:
it could be a bug which we introduced lately with isHTMLElement

FYI: @kotarella1110

> can you try the following:
> 
> ```
> () => {
>   handleSubmit(onSubmit)()
> }
> ```

Thank you for your quick reply bu it's still not working.
can you do a test on this beta version: react-hook-form@4.9.3-beta.1

> can you do a test on this beta version: react-hook-form@4.9.3-beta.1

Still same :(

> still the same error?

Yes, still same error.

`
Possible Unhandled Promise Rejection (id: 0):
ReferenceError: Node is not defined
ReferenceError: Node is not defined ...
`

https://snack.expo.io/@bluebill1049/react-hook-form-input 

looks like the beta is working for me. can you double check?
hmmm it could be expo has a wrapper

can someone verify 
`4.9.3-beta.2`
`4.9.3-beta.3`

I have tested on my android device both working.
I had the same error than @enestasdemir, but its gone with `react-hook-form@4.9.3-beta.2` !
hey @NicoleEtLui can you test out beta.3? thank you very much

Both `beta.2` and `beta.3` seems to work like a charm (ios and android simulators). 

* `react@16.12.0`
* `react-native@0.61.5` 

Thank you very much for the quick fix !
thank you very much for the verification. I will release the patch. @NicoleEtLui much appreciated.
It worked for me. Thank you so much

The issue is still when I trying to do from.reset()
But adding isWeb to the condition resolved
`if (value && isWeb && HTMLElement(value.ref) && value.ref.closest) {`

"react": "^16.12.0",
"react-hook-form": "^4.9.3",
"react-native": "0.61.5",
